intro: Galium scabridum, commonly known as rough bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium scabridum is often found in disturbed soils and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
